verses.text: The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.comment: Introduction to God's command; no major difference.

verses.text: "On the first day of the first month you shall set up the tabernacle of the tent of meeting.
verses.comment: "First day of the first month" refers to the Hebrew calendar; kept literal.

verses.text: You shall put the ark of the testimony in it, and you shall screen the ark with the veil.
verses.comment: "Screen the ark" refers to the curtain separating the Holy of Holies.

verses.text: And you shall bring in the table and arrange its setting; and you shall bring in the lampstand and set up its lamps.
verses.comment: "Arrange its setting" means setting out the showbread; language modernized but literal.

verses.text: You shall set the golden altar for incense before the ark of the testimony and put up the screen for the entrance of the tabernacle.
verses.comment: Retained 'golden altar of incense' for clarity.

verses.text: And you shall set the altar of burnt offering before the entrance of the tabernacle of the tent of meeting.
verses.comment: Literal rendering; no significant difference.

verses.text: And you shall set the basin between the tent of meeting and the altar, and put water in it.
verses.comment: 'Basin' refers to the laver for washing.

verses.text: And you shall set up the court all around, and hang up the screen for the gate of the court.
verses.comment: 'Screen for the gate' is the entrance curtain for the courtyard.

verses.text: Then you shall take the anointing oil and anoint the tabernacle and all that is in it, and consecrate it and all its furniture, so that it may be holy.
verses.comment: Consecration instructions; wording kept close.

verses.text: You shall also anoint the altar of burnt offering and all its utensils and consecrate the altar, so that the altar may be most holy.
verses.comment: 'Most holy' is a literal rendering of the superlative in Hebrew.

verses.text: And you shall anoint the basin and its stand, and consecrate it.
verses.comment: 'Basin and its stand' preserved as literal.

verses.text: You shall bring Aaron and his sons to the entrance of the tent of meeting and wash them with water.
verses.comment: Literal translation; washing as ritual purification.

verses.text: And you shall put the holy garments on Aaron, and anoint him and consecrate him, so that he may serve me as priest.
verses.comment: 'Serve me as priest' is an accurate rendering of the Hebrew.

verses.text: You shall bring his sons also and put tunics on them,
verses.comment: Clothing for priests; kept clear and literal.

verses.text: and anoint them, as you anointed their father, so that they may serve me as priests. And their anointing shall be for an everlasting priesthood throughout their generations.
verses.comment: Everlasting priesthood; Hebrew idiom kept literal.

verses.text: This Moses did; according to all that the LORD commanded him, so he did.
verses.comment: Hebrew repetition for emphasis preserved in English.

verses.text: In the first month in the second year, on the first day of the month, the tabernacle was set up.
verses.comment: Literal rendering of the date.

verses.text: Moses set up the tabernacle. He laid its bases, set up its frames, put in its bars, and raised up its pillars.
verses.comment: Tabernacle structure detailed; literal translation.

verses.text: He spread the tent over the tabernacle and put the covering of the tent over it, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
verses.comment: 'Tent' and 'covering' refer to the curtains; plural maintained if present in Hebrew.

verses.text: He took the testimony and put it into the ark, and set the poles on the ark and put the atonement cover on top of the ark.
verses.comment: 'Atonement cover' is the literal meaning of 'mercy seat.'

verses.text: He brought the ark into the tabernacle, set up the veil of the screen, and screened the ark of the testimony, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
verses.comment: 'Screened' used for literalness; veil refers to the barrier to the Most Holy Place.

verses.text: He put the table in the tent of meeting, on the north side of the tabernacle, outside the veil,
verses.comment: Clear, accurate spatial description.

verses.text: and arranged the bread on it before the LORD, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
verses.comment: 'Bread' refers to the showbread; literal.

verses.text: He put the lampstand in the tent of meeting, opposite the table, on the south side of the tabernacle,
verses.comment: Orientation given as in Hebrew.

verses.text: and set up the lamps before the LORD, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
verses.comment: 'Set up the lamps' as Hebrew.

verses.text: He put the golden altar in the tent of meeting before the veil,
verses.comment: Position of incense altar preserved.

verses.text: and burned fragrant incense on it, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
verses.comment: Fragrant incense described as per original.

verses.text: He put up the screen at the entrance of the tabernacle.
verses.comment: Entrance 'screen' literal.

verses.text: He set the altar of burnt offering at the entrance of the tabernacle of the tent of meeting, and offered on it the burnt offering and the grain offering, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
verses.comment: 'Offered' kept literal.

verses.text: He set the basin between the tent of meeting and the altar, and put water in it for washing,
verses.comment: Description of placement; literal.

verses.text: with which Moses and Aaron and his sons washed their hands and their feet,
verses.comment: Washing for ritual cleanness.

verses.text: when they went into the tent of meeting and when they approached the altar, they washed, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
verses.comment: Washing upon entering; accurate.

verses.text: And he set up the court around the tabernacle and the altar, and put up the screen for the gate of the court. So Moses finished the work.
verses.comment: Completion formula; literal.

verses.text: Then the cloud covered the tent of meeting, and the glory of the LORD filled the tabernacle.
verses.comment: 'Glory of the LORD' a common OT phrase, kept literal.

verses.text: And Moses was not able to enter the tent of meeting because the cloud settled on it, and the glory of the LORD filled the tabernacle.
verses.comment: Reason for Moses' exclusion made clear.

verses.text: Throughout all their journeys, whenever the cloud was taken up from over the tabernacle, the people of Israel set out.
verses.comment: Travel instructions; 'set out' is a standard Hebrew idiom.

verses.text: But if the cloud was not taken up, then they did not set out till the day that it was taken up.
verses.comment: Travel instructions continued; literal.

verses.text: For the cloud of the LORD was on the tabernacle by day, and fire was in it by night, in the sight of all the house of Israel throughout all their journeys.
verses.comment: Closing; traditional 'house of Israel' and pillar imagery kept literal.
